label: 鍍金
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: A method of plating metals, such as copper, with gold (or silver=togin). In ancient Japan an amalgam of gold, or silver, mixed with mercury was painted on the metal surface, and then heated to fix it and evaporate the mercury. Gilt copper or bronze is called kondō and gilt silver, kongon. [鍍銀、金銅、金銀]
